reviews.text:
Tried the chicken meat and my favourite bean curb stuff. It's spicy but somehow feel not salty enough, maybe it's a health thing but I would like to have just a little salt in.

Food is splendid!

We came as 3 Adults and 2 Kids

All portions are quite generous, nicely seasoned and had an authentic taste.

Highlight on the ÂÆ∂Â∏∏Ëèú as it appealed to us with the right amount of vinegar to taste.

Seafood fried rice is a hit with the kids and served as the base for the other dishes like the ÂõûÈîÖËÇâ and Âç§ÁâõËÇâ.

We had tasty skewers too to complement the meal

The star was their special roasted lamb ribs! It was succulent and a big potion enough for a few people!

Will come again!

Located at the 1st coffeeshop of Blk 22 Sin Ming Road (where the famous Âí∏ËèúÈ∏≠ used to be), it is now a Wonderful Chinese Restaurant.
Sizable portion and alfresco dining, it is a quiet place to enjoy a meal with the family.

Came here at 9+. Coffee shop is quite deserted but the coffee is the better one along this stretch of coffee shops. Price at $1.20, it‚Äôs very reasonable since most coffee shops charge more than that.

The coffee here has the strong nanyang kopi power that attracts me !!

I like the ban-Mian noodle stall here and The zhi char stall which is Fuzhou style - not bad most dishes serves with lala clams

Chicken rice serves both steam and roasted varieties
